sessions.title: Enhancing VoIP Apps with CallKit
sessions.description: CallKit is a new framework that lets your VoIP app integrate tightly with the native Phone UI. Learn how you can have your incoming calls displayed fully on the lock screen. Get details on how people can choose to use your app when making calls from the native Phone app's contacts, favorites, and recents. See how adopting CallKit lets your app coexist seamlessly with other active calls, and allow your calls to interact with CarPlay and Bluetooth accessories.

sessions.title: Proactive Suggestions Lab
sessions.description: Informing iOS and macOS about how your app works can enable them to proactively suggest your app in various places like in the Multitasking UI, when entering locations, on the lock screen, and more. Meet with the engineering teams behind many of these technologies to learn how to increase engagement in your app. Get answers to all your questions about how to implement these APIs in your app.

sessions.title: On-Demand Resources Lab
sessions.description: Using On-Demand Resources allows you to provide smaller app bundles, enable faster downloads, and add richer content. Get one-on-one technical guidance from Apple engineers about using On-Demand Resources in your apps. Bring your code and your questions.

sessions.title: Focus Interaction on tvOS
sessions.description: The focus interaction model is a critical component of an engaging and intuitive experience on tvOS. Learn more about how it works, some additions and changes to the API, as well as tips and tricks for making your tvOS app even better.

sessions.title: Xcode Open Hours
sessions.description: Stop by during Open Hours to talk with Apple engineers about things your learned during the week, to get answers to questions about new technologies you're experimenting with, or to find a fix for a difficult bug.

sessions.title: Safari and WebKit Lab
sessions.description: Apple engineers with extensive web technology expertise will be on hand to review your code and answer questions about web content development and debugging, optimizing WebKit views in your app, integrating Apple Pay into your website, and delivering Safari App extensions on macOS. We're here to help you get answers, learn about the latest web development techniques and tools, and improve your code.

sessions.title: Cocoa Lab
sessions.description: Meet with Apple engineers to have your questions about AppKit and Foundation answered. Bring your laptop and your code to work one-on-one and resolve any issues or questions you may have.

sessions.title: UI Testing and Continuous Integration with Xcode Lab
sessions.description: Learn how to get the most out to Xcode when creating a build and test strategy using UI Testing or setting up Xcode Server. Bring your code and your questions.

sessions.title: Diversity in Technology
sessions.description: The importance of diversity in the workplace is recognized at every great company and requires a sustained commitment to achieve. Join like-minded peers and industry leaders in an open conversation to share your experiences and ideas for creating and sustaining diversity in the workplace, navigating unconscious bias, taking unconventional paths through tech, and fostering innovation and entrepreneurship.

sessions.title: Quick Interaction Techniques for watchOS
sessions.description: Quick interactions are essential for creating a compelling Apple Watch app. Gain insights into new gesture, Digital Crown, navigation, and notification APIs, and see how to use these API alongside SceneKit and SpriteKit to create rich, glanceable interfaces. Explore how this expanded toolbox can help make your watch apps quick and responsive.

sessions.title: Public Transit in Apple Maps
sessions.description: Launched last year with iOS 9 and macOS El Capitan, the new Transit feature in Apple Maps is customized for each city where it's available. Hear about how the Apple Maps team ensures a great customer experience through a combination of transit agency data, field survey, and close attention to the unique transit culture of each city. If you're a transit agency, learn about how you can help to ensure your customers have the most reliable information in Apple Maps.

sessions.title: Xcode Open Hours
sessions.description: Stop by during Open Hours to talk with Apple engineers about things your learned during the week, to get answers to questions about new technologies you're experimenting with, or to find a fix for a difficult bug.

sessions.title: Swift Open Hours
sessions.description: Join Apple engineering teams as they answer your questions about Swift. Bring your code and your questions.

sessions.title: App Store Guideline Redesign Lab
sessions.description: Meet with the App Review team to discuss the guideline redesign. Bring your questions, learn the thought process behind the redesign and how it works.

sessions.title: The Bash
sessions.description: Celebrate your week of inspiration and learning as you mingle with friends, experience great music, and enjoy food and drinks at Bill Graham Civic Auditorium. To enter, you will need a WWDC badge and a wristband, available Thursday at Attendee Services at Moscone West. All attendees can attend the Bash and attendees 21 years or older may drink alcohol. Scholarship winners and attendees under 18 years of age can also choose to enjoy the Bash from the Scholarship Suite on the second floor. Transportation will be provided between Moscone West and Bill Graham Civic Auditorium, and you will be asked to show your WWDC badge and wristband upon boarding. Bag check is not available at the Bash, so please leave your bags at the hotel.

sessions.title: Core Animation and Quartz 2D Lab
sessions.room: Graphics, Games, and Media Lab B
sessions.description: Receive one-on-one technical assistance and troubleshooting advice from the Graphics and Imaging team. Get help with Core Animation, Core Graphics, Image Capture, Image I/O, ImageKit, PDFKit, ColorSync, and more. Bring your code and your questions.

sessions.title: What's New in HomeKit
sessions.description: Learn what's new with HomeKit in iOS 10 including support for new types of accessories such as cameras and doorbells, enhancements in remotely connecting with accessories, how set up of Wi-Fi HomeKit accessories has been greatly improved, and how to write HomeKit enabled tvOS Apps.

sessions.title: What's New in Auto Layout
sessions.description: Get details about new features of Auto Layout in Xcode, Cocoa and Cocoa Touch. Explore the new NSGridView, allowing your Cocoa app to easily build grid interfaces. Dive deeper into new tools that enable you to quickly diagnose layout issues in your interface. Learn about the new features in Xcode to quickly build adaptive interfaces.

sessions.title: Cocoa Lab
sessions.description: Meet with Apple engineers to have your questions about AppKit and Foundation answered. Bring your laptop and your code to work one-on-one and resolve any issues questions you may have.

sessions.title: Introducing Apple File System
sessions.description: The Apple File System (APFS) is the next-generation file system designed to scale from an Apple Watch to a Mac Pro. APFS is optimized for Flash/SSD storage, and engineered with encryption as a primary feature. Learn about APFS benefits versus HFS+ and how to make sure your file system code is compatible.

sessions.title: iTunes Connect Lab
sessions.description: Meet with members of the iTunes Connect team for expert guidance on App Analytics, In-app purchase and meta-data optimization techniques for publishing your apps through iTunes Connect. Bring your questions about how best to get information into iTunes Connect, deliver your binary, and automate the process.

sessions.title: What's New in HTTP Live Streaming
sessions.description: HTTP Live Streaming offers a reliable media playback experiences over a wide variety of network conditions. Join us to learn how to deliver offline playback using the same media assets you already host for online playback. See new additions to the HLS protocol, such as support for fragmented MP4 and in-playlist metadata.

sessions.title: Keeping Your Watch App Up to Date
sessions.description: Keeping your Apple Watch app up to date is key to creating a great experience on watchOS 3. Learn how to use the new background tasks to keep your complications and the new watchOS 3 Dock snapshots consistent with your app's underlying model. Discover how to get the most from NSURLSessions and Watch Connectivity to keep data fresh and glanceable.

sessions.title: Internationalization Best Practices
sessions.description: Following some simple practices when writing your app can help make it world-ready. Learn about what's new, how to take greater advantage of existing frameworks, and review some common pitfalls and how to avoid them. Hear some ideas for going one step further and optimizing your app for different countries.

sessions.title: What's New in Game Center
sessions.description: Dive into the latest additions to Game Center, Apple's social gaming network. Check out new capabilities for persistent game sessions and how they provide added flexibility for single-player, real-time multiplayer, and turn-based games. Learn about changes that streamline Game Center and a new way to send game invites and join multiplayer matches.

sessions.title: Interface Builder and Auto Layout Lab
sessions.description: Get expert help on how to use Auto Layout in your app. Bring your code and talk with Interface Builder engineers about how to optimally structure your user interface.

sessions.title: Validating HTTP Live Streams
sessions.description: HTTP Live Streaming enables the reliable delivery of media content over a wide variety of network conditions. Learn best practices in HLS authoring, see how to verify your streams using the HTTP Live Streaming tools, and apply the results to improve the performance of your streams.

sessions.title: Core Data Lab
sessions.description: Apple engineers will be on hand to review your code and answer questions about Core Data. We're here to help you get answers, learn about the latest development techniques and tools, and improve your code and apps.

sessions.title: tvOS Lab
sessions.description: The future of TV is apps, and tvOS is the foundation upon which these apps are built. Get one-on-one technical guidance from Apple engineers about your tvOS apps. Bring your code and your questions.

sessions.title: Kids and Education
sessions.description: iOS and tvOS are a revolution for Kids and Education. Join fellow Kids and Education development colleagues to discuss topics such as: Best Practices for Kids Content on Apple TV, Shared iPad and Classroom app for iPad, and Engaging with the Education Market. Share your experiences, get inspired, and encourage others.

sessions.title: Marvel: Making a Difference in the Real World
sessions.description: The heroes and villains of Marvel have captivated a worldwide audience for over 75 years. Marvel Games Creative Director Bill Rosemann lifts up the masks of Spider-Man, Black Panther, the Guardians of the Galaxy and more to reveal the true power behind the world's most heroic brand.

sessions.title: A Peek at 3D Touch
sessions.description: 3D Touch adds a completely new dimension to the iOS user interface and introduces an entirely new way to interact with your iPhone. Explore the existing API and get introduced to additions in iOS 10 that allow you to push the boundaries of 3D Touch. Learn about best practices for incorporating 3D Touch into your apps, how to add support for Quick Actions, Peek, and Pop.

sessions.title: Core Data Lab
sessions.description: Apple engineers will be on hand to review your code and answer questions about Core Data. We're here to help you get answers, learn about the latest development techniques and tools, and improve your code and apps.

sessions.title: Building Great Workout Apps
sessions.description: HealthKit provides robust tools for building great workout apps for Apple Watch. Learn how your workout app can collect data from Watch sensors, run and analyze data in real-time in the background, and contribute to Activity rings. Gain insights into creating a great standalone Watch experience and see how to display your workouts within the Health app and the Activity app on iOS.

sessions.title: Using Apple News Format to Create Rich and Responsive Stories
sessions.description: Apple News beautifully introduces new readers to your stories. Learn about Apple News Format and how it can be used to author rich, responsive stories that intelligently adapt to all screen sizes. Discover the many features of Apple News including interactive galleries, video, audio, and animations which help to make your content more engaging than ever.

sessions.title: Optimizing Web Content in Your App
sessions.description: The Web Inspector provides some sleek new tools to help you understand your app's web content performance and memory usage. Explore how you can use Web Inspector's new memory and JavaScript profiling tools to debug web content on iOS and macOS. Discover new features and learn best practices to maximize your effectiveness with the Web Inspector tools.

sessions.title: WatchKit Lab
sessions.description: WatchKit enables you to create actionable and responsive Apple Watch apps. Come by and meet with Apple engineers who write the frameworks to answer questions you might have. Bring your laptop, code, and learn how to optimize your use of WatchKit to achieve great layouts and enhance your app's core functionality.

sessions.title: What's New in GameplayKit
sessions.description: GameplayKit provides developers a collection of essential tools and techniques used to implement modern gameplay algorithms. Learn what's new in GameplayKit and check out advances in pathfinding, autonomous agents, and game AI, as well as many enhancements supporting GameplayKit in Xcode. Tap into new capabilities for 2D and 3D spatial partitioning, and explore noise-based procedural data generation useful for height maps, natural textures, and more.

sessions.title: Accessible Technology and Inclusive Design
sessions.description: Join fellow developers and Apple experts to explore the many ways that apps can be accessible and inclusive to everyone, including users with special needs. Discussions will range widely, covering technologies like VoiceOver, computer vision, and speech recognition, as well as accessible apps in entertainment, social media, banking, travel, language-learning, home automation, and more. Get inspired, share experiences, and envision new possibilities together.

sessions.title: Xcode Open Hours
sessions.description: Stop by during Open Hours to talk with Apple engineers about things your learned during the week, to get answers to questions about new technologies you're experimenting with, or to find a fix for a difficult bug.

sessions.title: Working with Wide Color
sessions.description: Discover the fascinating details behind the display of color on Apple platforms. Go beyond the basics and learn how your apps can take advantage of a wider and deeper representation of color on iOS and macOS. Gain specific insights from the experts on optimizing your artwork asset pipeline and explore new API to develop more vivd, true to life experiences.

sessions.title: Networking Lab 1
sessions.description: Engineers from the Apple networking teams will be on hand to provide expert advice, to help you troubleshoot networking problems, improve networking performance, and make sure your apps are IPv6 compatible. Bring your laptop, your code, and your questions.

sessions.title: Audio and Audio Unit Extensions Lab
sessions.room: Graphics, Games, and Media Lab D
sessions.description: iOS, macOS, watchOS and tvOS offer a rich set of tools and APIs for recording, processing, and playing back audio in your apps. Audio Unit Extensions can provide your App with sophisticated audio manipulation and processing capabilities. Get one-on-one technical guidance from Apple engineers about using Audio APIs and Audio Unit Extensions. Bring your code and your questions.

sessions.title: Live Photo and Core Image Lab
sessions.room: Graphics, Games, and Media Lab D
sessions.description: Live Photos enables an entirely new way to bring still photos to life. RAW and wide color support adds possibilities for image adjustments. Core Image provides a powerful framework for editing and processing these type of images. Get one-on-one technical guidance from Apple engineers about using Core Image in your apps. Bring your code and your questions.

sessions.title: Understanding Swift Performance
sessions.description: In this advanced session, find out how structs, classes, protocols, and generics are implemented in Swift. Learn about their relative costs in different dimensions of performance. See how to apply this information to speed up your code.

sessions.title: Safari and WebKit Lab
sessions.description: Apple engineers with extensive web technology expertise will be on hand to review your code and answer questions about web content development and debugging, optimizing WebKit views in your app, integrating Apple Pay into your website, and delivering Safari App extensions on macOS. We're here to help you get answers, learn about the latest web development techniques and tools, and improve your code.

sessions.title: HealthKit Lab
sessions.description: HealthKit APIs allow health and fitness app developers to share data with the Health app and with one another. Drop by and speak with Apple engineers to help you make a great experience using HealthKit. If you have a question, a bug to narrow down, or a session follow-up question, come by with your laptop, code and get the answers from the team who creates the framework.

sessions.title: App Search and Spotlight Lab
sessions.description: Understand how to make your app more discoverable and provide more relevant Spotlight and Safari search results. Apple engineers will be available to review your code and answer your technical questions. Stop by with and we'll work with you one-on-one to make your app's search results the best they can be.

sessions.title: Apple Developer Program Support By Appointment Lab
sessions.description: Get help with updating your developer account, managing your development devices and certificates, renewing your membership, and more. Be sure to have your Apple ID, Team ID, and any related information that will help us assist you. Request an appointment starting at 7 a.m. for that day only by visiting https://developer.apple.com/wwdc/consultations/

sessions.title: What's New in Accessibility
sessions.description: Explore the new accessibility features for iOS, tvOS, and macOS. Gain specific knowledge of how best to adapt your app to make it accessible to everyone, regardless of their physical or learning abilities. Learn from the experts about advanced accessibility topics and how best to structure your app interface for accessibility.

sessions.title: Finance By Appointment Lab
sessions.description: Get details on setting up your banking and tax information in iTunes Connect, and get assistance with financial reports and payments. You may request an appointment starting at 7 a.m. for that day only by visiting https://developer.apple.com/wwdc/consultations/.

sessions.title: HomeKit Lab
sessions.description: Bring your HomeKit development questions, accessory, and app to this lab for one-on-one technical guidance with Apple engineers.

sessions.title: ResearchKit and CareKit Lab
sessions.description: Apple engineers will be on hand to review your code and answer questions about CareKit and ResearchKit. Any technical, code-based, or session follow-up question are fair game so don't be shy. We're here to answer your answers, to help you learn about the latest development techniques and tools, and to improve your code and apps.

sessions.title: Introducing Search Ads
sessions.description: Search Ads provides a new way to increase awareness of your apps in App Store search results. Learn how sponsored ads in App Store search work, see a preview of the powerful targeting options, reporting and attribution features and how quick and easy it is to get started.

sessions.title: Thread Sanitizer and Static Analysis
sessions.description: Xcode 8 makes it easier to find several new categories of bugs with improvements in Runtime Sanitization and the Clang Static Analyzer. The Thread Sanitizer will help you find data races and other concurrency bugs. The static analyzer has been extended to search for localizability issues, check nullability, and find memory leaks in MRR code.

sessions.title: iMessage Apps and Stickers Lab
sessions.description: iMessage Apps, including sticker packs, are a new way for your app to integrate with people's conversations in Messages. Meet the Messages engineering team and get expert one-on-one help to build new ways for people to engage with your apps from within Messages.

sessions.title: User Interface Design by Appointment Lab
sessions.description: Get advice on making your apps visually compelling and simple to use. Come prepared with a working prototype, development build, or your released app. Appointments are required and are limited to one developer for the duration of the conference. Request an appointment starting at 7 a.m. for that day only by visiting https://developer.apple.com/wwdc/consultations/ .

sessions.title: Accessibility User Interface by Appointment Lab
sessions.description: Meet with Apple's accessibility design and usability experts to evaluate your app and learn what's needed to make it accessible and simple to use for everyone. Learn the basics of VoiceOver and other accessibility features to better understand how customers with varying needs can use your app. Come prepared with a working prototype, development build, or your released app. Appointments are required and are limited to one per developer. Appointments can be made on Tuesday and Wednesday starting at 7 a.m. for that day only by visiting https://developer.apple.com/wwdc/consultations/.

sessions.title: Advances in SceneKit Rendering
sessions.description: SceneKit is a fully featured high-level graphics framework enabling your apps and games to create 3D animated scenes and effects. Witness the biggest leap forward in SceneKit yet with the introduction of its new Physically-Based Renderer (PBR). Dive into new APIs for accurate materials, physically-based lights, HDR effects, and enhancements in Model I/O. Walk through an example game using PBR and see how to integrate its workflow into your development.

sessions.title: NSUserActivity, Universal Links, and Handoff Lab
sessions.description: NSUserActivity is a critical component underlying many Apple APIs. Universal Links let you standardize on https URLs so people can get to your content regardless of whether your app is installed. Meet the Universal Links and Handoff engineering teams to get answers to all your questions about how to add NSUserActivity to your app in order. Bring your laptop, your code, and your questions.

sessions.title: Getting the Most Out of HealthKit
sessions.description: HealthKit offers more than ever to developers joining in Apple's vibrant health and fitness ecosystem. Discover new ways to integrate the popular activity-tracking features of Apple Watch with your own app. Learn how to contribute to an even more complete picture of users' health data by reading and writing Health Documents from your organization. Review core concepts for working with HealthKit and explore best practices for managing data to ensure your users enjoy a seamless experience.

sessions.title: Disability and Innovation: The Universal Benefits of Accessible Design
sessions.description: White House Champion of Change, Forbes 30 under 30 leader, and BBC Women of Africa Hero, Haben Girma is an acclaimed accessibility and inclusion advocate. The first deaf blind person to graduate from Harvard Law School, Haben champions equal access to information for people with disabilities, earning her recognition from both President Obama and President Clinton. Through this presentation, Haben will share how designing with accessibility in mind benefits not just users with disabilities, but developers, too. Throughout history, disability has sparked innovation, leading to breakthroughs in wide-ranging inventions from keyboards to telephones. Hear Haben's remarkable story and learn how incorporating universal access principles into product development can increase access for people with disabilities while simultaneously improving the overall usability of your app.

sessions.title: Apple Developer Program Support By Appointment Lab
sessions.description: Get help with updating your developer account, managing your development devices and certificates, renewing your membership, and more. Be sure to have your Apple ID, Team ID, and any related information that will help us assist you. Request an appointment starting at 7 a.m. for that day only by visiting https://developer.apple.com/wwdc/consultations/

sessions.title: User Interface Design by Appointment Lab
sessions.description: Get advice on making your apps visually compelling and simple to use. Come prepared with a working prototype, development build, or your released app. Appointments are required and are limited to one developer for the duration of the conference. Request an appointment starting at 7 a.m. for that day only by visiting https://developer.apple.com/wwdc/consultations/ .

sessions.title: App Review By Appointment Lab
sessions.description: Meet with the App Review team to discuss the review process and get clarification on the App Store Review Guidelines for iOS, macOS, watchOS, tvOS, TestFlight and more. Request an appointment starting at 7 a.m. for that day only by visiting https://developer.apple.com/wwdc/consultations/.

sessions.title: Introducing Swift Playgrounds
sessions.description: Learn more about Swift Playgrounds, the new iPad app that teaches coding using the powerful Swift programming language. Explore the featured content, complete with puzzles that help you master each coding concept. Learn more about the coding features of Swift Playgrounds and see how the editing experience was re-imagined for touch. Learn to use the included templates to build playgrounds and look at the available features in the new playground book format.

sessions.title: Tapping into Innovative Solutions to Save the World's Wildlife
sessions.description: Wildlife populations across the globe face innumerable threats that have resulted in dwindling numbers of many species. Ginette Hemley, SVP of Wildlife Conservation at World Wildlife Fund, will take us through many of the bold new approaches to conservation that organizations like WWF are taking to tackle these challenges. One of the most promising and potentially game-changing ideas for solving conservation problems around the world is by applying technology in creative new ways. From examining polar bear DNA to utilizing devices such as thermal imaging cameras and gunshot detectors to drawing upon the power of social networks and apps, learn about the surprising ways that WWF and its partners are harnessing the power of technology to keep up with the planet's most urgent wildlife conservation challenges.

sessions.title: Business and Marketing By Appointment Lab
sessions.description: Get advice on the business models, pricing strategies, launch planning, marketing strategy, international expansion, and getting featured on the App Store. Bring a demo of your app or game, your business and marketing plans, and any related information. Request an appointment starting at 7 a.m. for that day only by visiting https://developer.apple.com/wwdc/consultations/.

sessions.title: App Review By Appointment Lab
sessions.description: Meet with the App Review team to discuss the review process and get clarification on the App Store Review Guidelines for iOS, macOS, watchOS, tvOS, TestFlight and more. You may request an appointment starting at 7 a.m. for that day only by visiting https://developer.apple.com/wwdc/consultations/.

sessions.title: App Review By Appointment Lab
sessions.description: Meet with the App Review team to discuss the review process and get clarification on the App Store Review Guidelines for iOS, macOS, watchOS, tvOS, TestFlight and more. Request an appointment starting at 7 a.m. for that day only by visiting https://developer.apple.com/wwdc/consultations/.

sessions.title: Business and Marketing By Appointment Lab
sessions.description: Get advice on the business models, pricing strategies, launch planning, marketing strategy, international expansion, and getting featured on the App Store. Bring a demo of your app or game, your business and marketing plans, and any related information. Request an appointment starting at 7 a.m. for that day only by visiting https://developer.apple.com/wwdc/consultations/.

sessions.title: Apple Marketing Communications By Appointment Lab
sessions.description: Learn how to be considered for potential promotional opportunities on Apple.com, Apple Retail Stores, Channel, and Advertising. You may request an appointment starting at 7 a.m. for that day only by visiting https://developer.apple.com/wwdc/consultations/.

sessions.title: iTunes Connect and App Analytics By Appointment Lab
sessions.description: Get help with iTunes Connect and features like TestFlight and App Analytics. Get answers from experts on everything from in-app and app purchase setup to subscriptions, search, Sales and Trends, and more. Request same-day appointments starting at 7 a.m. by visiting https://developer.apple.com/wwdc/consultations/.

sessions.title: NSURLSession: New Features and Best Practices
sessions.description: NSURLSession provides a rich set of methods to support uploading and downloading content via HTTP and newer HTTP-based protocols, authentication with web servers, local caching of resources, and transfers that occur in the background while your app isn't running — simplifying the complexities of modern day networking. Learn about new enhancements in HTTP/2, introspection capabilities with networking metrics, and security and privacy enhancements for you and your customers.

sessions.description: Get assistance on how metadata, keywords and campaigns can improve your app store placement and downloads. Request an appointment starting at 7 a.m. for that day only by visiting https://developer.apple.com/wwdc/consultations/.

Request an appointment starting at 7 a.m. for that day only by visiting https://developer.apple.com/wwdc/consultations/.

sessions.title: SceneKit Lab
sessions.room: Graphics, Games, and Media Lab A
sessions.description: SceneKit is an innovative graphics framework enabling your apps and games to efficiently load, manipulate, and render 3D scenes. Receive expert assistance and helpful tips from the SceneKit engineering team. Bring your code and your questions.

sessions.title: Swift API Design Guidelines
sessions.description: Swift 3 introduces new API Design Guidelines specifically crafted to the unique character of Swift for clear, concise code. This talk will explore the philosophy behind the Swift API Design Guidelines and their application throughout the Swift Standard Library and the Cocoa and Cocoa Touch APIs. See how this API transformation will affect your Swift code and learn how to ensure a smooth transition to Swift 3. Learn how Swift 3 imports Objective-C APIs and how to expose rich Swift interfaces for existing Objective-C libraries.

sessions.title: Talking In Pictures: Reconstructing the Building Blocks of Language
sessions.description: When Ajit Narayanan began working on technologies for children with disabilities in India in 2008, it was the beginning of an incredible journey down a rabbit hole — one that took him and his team on a wild ride across the worlds of electrical engineering, autism, cross-cultural communication and the mathematics of language. His journey led him to build Avaz, a wheelchair-mounted tablet to help people with disabilities communicate, then even more ambitiously, to invent FreeSpeech, an entirely new visual language that could break down language barriers altogether. Ajit will talk about the series of events that led to the creation of the Avaz and FreeSpeech apps, their impact in India and around the world (earning him the National Award for Empowerment of People with Disabilities from the President of India) and his ideas on the transformative role that apps can play in education.

sessions.title: Visual Debugging with Xcode
sessions.description: Discover Xcode's enhancements for debugging autolayout issues at runtime. Learn how issues inside complex GKStateMachine objects can be easily debugged at runtime. Gain insight into finding performance bottlenecks inside SpriteKit and SceneKit apps more easily with the enhanced FPS gauge. Understand how to fix leaked and abandoned memory in your app by inspecting the heap from within your typical Xcode debugging workflow.
